gurmukhi: mg pd Awid bKwin kY iCd pd AMq bKwn ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN lIjo cqur pCwn ]312]
transliteration: Mag Pad Aadh Bakhaan(i) Kai Chhid Pad Ant Bakhaan|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Leejo Chatur Pachhaad||312||
translation: Saying the word “Mad” in the beginning and then adding the word “Chhid” at the end, the names of Paash are recognized by the wise people.312.

gurmukhi: mwrg Awid bKwin kY mwr bKwnhu AMq ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN inksq clY ibAMq ]313]
transliteration: Maarag Aadh Bakhaan(i) Kai Maar Bakhaanoh Ant|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Niksat Chalai Beant||313||
translation: Saying the word “Marg” in the beginning and keeping the word “Maar” at the end, innumerable names of Paash continue to be evolved.313.

gurmukhi: mwrg Awid pd aucir kY krKx puin pd dyhu ] AwXuD bhur bKwnIAY nwm pwNs liK lyhu ]314]
transliteration: Panth Aadh Pad Ouchar(i) Kai Karkhan Poun(i) Pad Deh(u)|| Aayudh Bahur Bakhaaneeai Naam Paans Lakh(i) Leh(u)||314||
translation: Uttering firstly the word “Panth” and then adding the words “Karshan and “Aayudh”, the names of Paash are known.314.

gurmukhi: bwq Awid pd aucir kY hw AsqRwNq bKwn ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN cInhu gunn inDwn ]315]
transliteration: Baat Aadh Pad Ouchar(i) Kai Haa Astraant Bakhaan|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Cheenoh Gounan Nidhaan||315||
translation: Saying the word “Vaat” primarily and then adding the words “Haa” and “Astar” at the end, the talented people know the names of Paash.315.

gurmukhi: rwh Awid pd aucrAY irp kih AsqR bKwn ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN cqur lIjIAhu jwn ]316]
transliteration: Raah Aadh Pad Ouchreeai Rip Kah(i) Astra Bakhaan|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Chatur Leejeeauh Jaan||316||
translation: Uttering the words “Ripu and Astar” after saying “Raash”, the names of Paash are formed, which are comprehended by the wise people.316.

gurmukhi: piRQmY Dn Sbdo aucir hrqw AwXud cIn ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN cqur lIjIAhu cInH ]317]
transliteration: Prithmai Dhan Shabdo Ouchar(i) Hartaa Aayudh Cheen|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Chatur Leejeeauh Cheehn||317||
translation: Uttering the word “Dhan” in the beginning and then speaking “Hartaa-Aayudh”, all the names of Paash are known.317.

gurmukhi: mwl Awid SbdocR kY kwl jwl kih AMq ] skl nwm ieh pwNs ky cInhu pRgXwvMq ]318]
transliteration: Maal Aadh Shabdochra Kai Kaal Jaal Kah(i) Ant|| Sakal Naam Eh Paans Ke Cheenoh Pragyaavant||318||
translation: Uttering primarily the word “Maal” and adding “Kaal Jaal” at the end, the talented people know all the names of Paash.318.

gurmukhi: mwXw hrn aucwir kY AwXuD bhur bKwn ] skl nwm ey pwNs ky cqur ic`q mih jwn ]319]
transliteration: Maayaa Haran Oucdaar(i) Kai Aayudh Bahur Bakhaan|| Sakal Naam E Paans Ke Chatur Chitt Maih Jaan||319||
translation: Uttering firstly the word “Maya-Haran” and then adding the word “Aayudh”, the wise people know all the names of Paash.319.

gurmukhi: mghw pQhw pYNfhw Dnhw diRbh soie ] jw ky fr qy so suno pQk n aubrXo koie ]320]
transliteration: Mag-haa Path-haa Paind-haa Dribah Soe|| Jaa Ke Dar Te So Souno Pathak Na Udaryo Koe||320||
translation: “Mag-haa, Path-haa Dhanhaa, Dravya-haa etc.,” are all the names of Paash, in whose fear no traveler could be redeemed.320.

gurmukhi: ibKIAw Awid bKwin kY AwXuD AMq aucwr ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN lIjhu cqur suDwr ]321]
transliteration: Bikhiaa Aadh Bakhaan(i) Kai Aayudh Ant Ouchaar|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Leejoh Chatur Sudhaar||321||
translation: Saying the word “Vish” in the beginning and then adding “Aayudh” the names of Paash are correctly known in the mind.321.

gurmukhi: ibK Sbdwd aucwir ky dwiek AsqR bKwn ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN cqur lIjIAhu jwn ]322]
transliteration: Bikh Shabdaad Oucdaar(i) Kai Daaik Astra Bakhaan|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Chatur Laajeeauh Jaan||322||
translation: Saying primarily “Vish” and then adding “Dayak Astar”, all the names of Paash are formed, which are known by the wise people.322.

gurmukhi: cMdRBgw ky nwm lY piq kih AsqR bKwn ] nwm pwNs ky hoq hYN cInhu pRgXwvwn ]323]
transliteration: Channdrabhagad Ke Naam Lai Pat(i) Kah(i) Astra Bakhaan|| Naam Paans Ke Hot Hain Cheenoh Pragyaavaan||323||
translation: Naming the river “Chandarbhagaa” and then adding “Pati Astar”, the talented people recognize the names of Paash.323.

gurmukhi: squdÍ nwQ bKwin kY puin kih AsqR ibsyK ] skl nwm ey pwNs ky inksq clq AsyK ]324]
transliteration: Sat(u)drav Naath Bakhaan(i) Kai Poun(i) Kah(i) Astra Bisekh|| Sakal Naam E Paans Ke Niksat Chalat Asekh||324||
translation: Uttering “Shatdrav Naath” and then saying “Astar Vishesh”, many names of Pash continue to be evolved.324.

gurmukhi: sq Sbdwid bKwn kY eysrwsqR kih AMq ] nwm skl ey pwNs ky cIn lyhu buDvMq ]325]
transliteration: Sat Shabdaadh Bakhaan Kai Esraastra Kah(i) Ant|| Naam Sakal E Paans Ke Cheen Leh(u) Budhvant||325||
translation: Uttering the word “Shat” in the beginning and then adding “Aishrastra” at the end, the wise people recognize all the names of Paash.325.
